Convert parameter summary dataframe to FraNchEstYN parameter list

Source: R/utils.R
df_to_parameters.Rd

Usage

df_to_parameters(
  df,
  atomic_if_missing_meta = FALSE,
  range_pct = 0.1,
  zero_buffer = 1e-06
)

Arguments

df

A `data.frame` with at least columns `Parameter` and `value`.

range_pct

Numeric, optional. Percentage of the mean value to define min/max ranges (default = 0.2, i.e. ±20

A nested list of parameters. Each element contains:

  • min — lower bound of the parameter (mean - range).

  • max — upper bound of the parameter (mean + range).

  • value — central value (mean).

  • calibration — logical flag, set to FALSE by default.

The function rebuilds a list-of-lists in the same format as FraNchEstYN::diseaseParameters or FraNchEstYN::cropParameters. This is useful for reusing averaged parameter estimates across simulations. This function converts a dataframe of parameter estimates into the nested list format used by FraNchEstYN (`cropParameters` or `diseaseParameters`).The ranges are computed as value * (1 ± range_pct). This ensures each parameter has a plausible min and max around the central estimate. param_summary <- data.frame( Parameter = c("RUEreducerDamage","LatentPeriod"), value = c(0.5, 120) ) df_to_parameters(param_summary, range_pct = 0.1)
